page.title: 02FLETCHING PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The Church of St Andrew and St Mary the Virgin though not mentioned in the 1086 Domesday Book was first built in stone at this time. Windows in the tower are of the late Saxon Period. The present building, one of the largest churches in the district was completed about 1230 in Cruciform Early English style.The tall octagonal spire is visible far into the surrounding countryside. An unusual feature of the chancel is that it is four feet wider than the nave. In the South Transept are an Elizabethan alabaster tomb and a fine brass memorial, circa 1380 of a knight and his lady, In a village that has changed little in recent times the church remains a focal point. {D Skan
